text: Yes, A7 B are independent. We have P(A) = P({2,4,6}) =3/6 =1/2 P(B) = P({1,2,3,4}) = 4/6 = 2/3 P(ANB) = P({2,4}) = 2/6 = 1/3 = P(A)P(B) No, B, C are not independent; these events are dependent. We have P(B) = P({1,2,3,4}) = 4/6 = 2/3 P(C) = P({3,4,5,6}) = 4/6 = 2/3 P(BNC)=P({3,4}) =2/6 =1/3 # 4/9 = P(B)P(C). @ answered Aug 21, 2022
